title: Federalism increase in Mexico since PRI

content.question: Which of the following is true of federalism in Mexico?

choices.label: There has been a strong trend toward increased centralization of policy functions over the last two decades.
Since the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) no longer dominates electoral politics, governors have become more willing to exercise their formal powers.
Members of the Mexican Senate are appointed by the state legislatures and can be recalled by them at any time.
The president has the constitutional authority to dissolve state legislatures for failing to implement national laws.
The Chamber of Deputies has often exercised its constitutional authority to impeach state governors.

content.answer: Since the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) no longer dominates electoral politics, governors have become more willing to exercise their formal powers.
